title: PSA ARMIES
body: Listen up you sex starved/obsessed people. Y’all pretend that the boys are to be treated like babies with respect and care, yet you come on here and write the most disgusting,vile and dark shit about them. You write about sexual or physical violence you dont respect other armies when they say that you’re taking it too far. So explain to me why someone would start insulting someone because of they wrote the most innocent story out there by calling them names knowing nothing about what they’ve been through. y’all are a sad bunch and pathetic. take you’re starved/obsessed ass to pornhub and LEAVE PEOPLE alone.Respect others. If you feel offended and feel like coming at me be prepared.

masterlist

title: POLYGLOT (1) / JJK
body:
the prefix poly- comes from Greek and means “many” or “multi-” the last part of the word comes from the Greek term glōtta, meaning “language” or “tongue”
= a person who knows and is able to use several languages.

Word: I’m no writer and English ain’t my mother tongue, but I’ll try my very best to make this as great as I possibly can. I’ll try to be your polyglot and put my weird romantic dreams into words.
Pairing: reader x Jungkook
Genre: romance
Warnings: none

Word count: 1371 words

Summary: Your academic background consists of a wide range of languages. You only studied Korean with a linguistic point of view, as Hangul is a perfect phonetic language. Learning a new culture and their music always excited you so when an opportunity arrises to be a translator in Korea you didn’t even hesitate for a second. No, you immediately booked your one way ticket without even being certain that you had the job.

PART (2) / PART (3) / PART (4) / PART (5) / PART (6)

“Welcome to Seoul, Korea.” It was the stewardess’ voice that finally woke you. “It is 9°C outside and the time is 16h47.” The person next to you was already trying to get all of their stuff together while your things were scattered on the floor. You were the last to leave the plane as you had struggled finding all your belongings. Your shoe was somehow found two rows before yours which you only managed to find thanks to the love staff of the flight you had mostly slept through. 

“Thank you so much for the nice flight.” You thanked them in Korean and they were pleasantly surprised you knew their mother tongue. That little thing was what you loved the most about speaking another language. People were usually shocked you spoke their words, their thoughts and were often pleased with your knowledge. 

“Have a nice stay in Seoul and don’t forget to enjoy the weather and cherry blossoms.” The smallest of the staff said while you got off the plane. If all Koreans were as nice as them then you’d have a great time working here. Yes, working. The reason for your sudden one way flight to Seoul was because you were offered a job here. You still had to take an interview and they still had about 5 applicants for the position. 

You were nervous but strangely also very calm. You were certain of your own abilities and speaking many European languages was one of your strengths. The past two years you had also studied Korean so you were sure to be the perfect fit for the spot. They had only called you once. There was a position to be a translator in Korea and the only specific requirement was to speak a certain amount of languages and being able to transform these in Korean. Check.

It was the first time to speak Korean in the country the language belonged too. There were a few mistakes made but people understood and were surprised by how fluent you were. Getting a taxi to your hotel was no problem and checking in was the same story. The only problem you encountered was the jet lag and the sudden need to sight see every little corner of Seoul. You decided it was best to stay in your hotel today and to eat a nice traditional meal as you had your first interview tomorrow and you wanted to be awake for at least the most part.

Finding it hard to sleep you had stayed up learning some new words and practicing some sentences you knew you struggled with. By the time you felt tired again it was time to get into the shower and hurry yourself in clothes to the interview. You barely sat in your seat after almost being late (you were five minutes early but we all know that is almost too late in job interview world), and a tall man in sharp suit made its way over to you.

“Are you ready?” And with these words your crazy ass story started. You had to go through security and they went through your bag as if a bomb could be hidden in the little bumbag you carried. They made sure every part of your body wasn’t covered in some kind of explosive material and it made you wonder where the hell you were. What kind of translating job was there to have these kind of extreme measurements of safety. 

“I’m really sorry but we take the safety of our clients very serious. This won’t be an everyday kind of thing so don’t try to worry.” The man was the exact opposite of you. He was calm and comfortable while you felt you were more like a crazy unstable person being arrested because she tried to bite the bus driver. 

“I’m glad you take the safety of your clients serious. It just would’ve been nice to know this beforehand so I wouldn’t have had six different lipsticks in one bag. That kind of looks suspicious, you know.” The man smiled and you finally started to relax. 

“Let’s hope there will be a next time, miss Y/L/N. The past weeks there have also been a couple of interviews and the part still hasn’t been filled.” 

“I’m very competent for this job and I will show them that the best I can.” 

“I’m sure you will. Please, follow me and I will take you to your clients.” He started power walking toward the building and you almost had to run to keep up with him. Finally after a long elevator ride and running door through door, you halted at a large glass door. He signaled for you to wait while he entered the room. You heard some voices but couldn’t make out the words they were saying. 

Suddenly the door opened and you nervously entered the room, taking one last glance at your reflection. You looked a bit tense but you also saw a confident young woman and this made you even more excited than before. Let’s get this bread, you thought to yourself.

“Hello everyone. My name is Y/N Y/L/N and I’m here for the position of translator.” You greeted all the people in the room. You were surprised by how many people were gathered in the little meeting room. The oldest offered you a seat and a bottle of water you gladly accepted. After being seated your eyes dared to look at the other people for the first time and you immediately recognized half of the people. BTS were seated in comfy chairs in a very plain business meeting room. The contrast almost made you giggle as half of them were dressed in bright colors and baggy clothes. You tried your best to keep your attention to the older person, who must be their manager of some sort, but to be honest it was difficult. Of course you knew who BTS was, it was because of a K-POP documentary on Netflix you had taken an interest in Korean in the first place. Them being the globally most famous K-POP act were mentioned once or twice in the documentary.

“So Y/N, tell us something about yourself.” 

“What I tell you depends on what you want to hear. I can tell you about where I’m from and why I speak so many languages. I can also talk about why I, a European girl, learned Korean and if I’m familiar with the seven boys present in this plain meeting room.” Your smile never left your face while talking but the blush on your cheeks was definitely prominent and not easily hidden. The older man looked a bit shocked but you weren’t sure if it was because of your rudeness or perfect Korean. 

“So are you a fan?” The tallest of the group, and if you remembered correctly, his name was RM. 

“To be honest, K-POP is a handy tool to learn Korean as they talk about easy subjects and emotions all the while being catchy. So yes I’m a fan in the broad sense of the word but I won’t be asking for an autograph or jump you.” The last part got some laughs out of the group and everyone started to relax, including you.

“Do you know our names?” This was asked by the guy in blue hair and you were instantly drawn to his smile. 

“I do know your names, but only the ones you gave yourself. I don’t know your real names to be very honest with you V.” His smile only got wider when you said his stage name.

“We should introduce ourselves. Let’s do a round.” And that was how you kind of started to befriend BTS, how they chose you to be their translator and when you first noticed the sparkly brown eyes of the maknae.

Warnings: none

You barely sat in your seat after almost being late (you were five minutes early but we all know that is almost too late in job interview world), and a tall man in sharp suit made its way over to you.

“Are you ready?” And with these words your crazy ass story started. You had to go through security and they went through your bag as if a bomb could be hidden in the little bumbag you carried. They made sure every part of your body wasn’t covered in some kind of explosive material and it made you wonder where the hell you were. What kind of translating job was there to have these kind of extreme measurements of safety. 

“I’m really sorry but we take the safety of our clients very serious. This won’t be an everyday kind of thing so don’t try to worry.” The man was the exact opposite of you. He was calm and comfortable while you felt you were more like a crazy unstable person being arrested because she tried to bite the bus driver. 

“I’m glad you take the safety of your clients serious. It just would’ve been nice to know this beforehand so I wouldn’t have had six different lipsticks in one bag. That kind of looks suspicious, you know.” The man smiled and you finally started to relax. 

“Let’s hope there will be a next time, miss Y/L/N. The past weeks there have also been a couple of interviews and the part still hasn’t been filled.” 

“I’m very competent for this job and I will show them that the best I can.” 

“I’m sure you will. Please, follow me and I will take you to your clients.” He started power walking toward the building and you almost had to run to keep up with him. Finally after a long elevator ride and running door through door, you halted at a large glass door. He signaled for you to wait while he entered the room. You heard some voices but couldn’t make out the words they were saying. 

Suddenly the door opened and you nervously entered the room, taking one last glance at your reflection. You looked a bit tense but you also saw a confident young woman and this made you even more excited than before. Let’s get this bread, you thought to yourself.

“Hello everyone. My name is Y/N Y/L/N and I’m here for the position of translator.” You greeted all the people in the room. You were surprised by how many people were gathered in the little meeting room. The oldest offered you a seat and a bottle of water you gladly accepted. After being seated your eyes dared to look at the other people for the first time and you immediately recognized half of the people. BTS were seated in comfy chairs in a very plain business meeting room. The contrast almost made you giggle as half of them were dressed in bright colors and baggy clothes. You tried your best to keep your attention to the older person, who must be their manager of some sort, but to be honest it was difficult. Of course you knew who BTS was, it was because of a K-POP documentary on Netflix you had taken an interest in Korean in the first place. Them being the globally most famous K-POP act were mentioned once or twice in the documentary.

“So Y/N, tell us something about yourself.” 

“What I tell you depends on what you want to hear. I can tell you about where I’m from and why I speak so many languages. I can also talk about why I, a European girl, learned Korean and if I’m familiar with the seven boys present in this plain meeting room.” Your smile never left your face while talking but the blush on your cheeks was definitely prominent and not easily hidden. The older man looked a bit shocked but you weren’t sure if it was because of your rudeness or perfect Korean. 

“So are you a fan?” The tallest of the group, and if you remembered correctly, his name was RM. 

“To be honest, K-POP is a handy tool to learn Korean as they talk about easy subjects and emotions all the while being catchy. So yes I’m a fan in the broad sense of the word but I won’t be asking for an autograph or jump you.” The last part got some laughs out of the group and everyone started to relax, including you.

“Do you know our names?” This was asked by the guy in blue hair and you were instantly drawn to his smile. 

“I do know your names, but only the ones you gave yourself. I don’t know your real names to be very honest with you V.” His smile only got wider when you said his stage name.

“We should introduce ourselves. Let’s do a round.” And that was how you kind of started to befriend BTS, how they chose you to be their translator and when you first noticed the sparkly brown eyes of the maknae.
trail.content_abstract:
the prefix poly- comes from Greek and means “many” or “multi-” the last part of the word comes from the Greek term glōtta, meaning “language” or “tongue”
= a person who knows and is able to use several languages.

Word: I’m no writer and English ain’t my mother tongue, but I’ll try my very best to make this as great as I possibly can. I’ll try to be your polyglot and put my weird romantic dreams into words.
Pairing: reader x Jungkook
Genre: romance
Warnings: none

Word count: 1371 words

Summary: Your academic background consists of a wide range of languages. You only studied Korean with a linguistic point of view, as Hangul is a perfect phonetic language. Learning a new culture and their music always excited you so when an opportunity arrises to be a translator in Korea you didn’t even hesitate for a second. No, you immediately booked your one way ticket without even being certain that you had the job.

PART (2) / PART (3) / PART (4) / PART (5) / PART (6)

“Welcome to Seoul, Korea.” It was the stewardess’ voice that finally woke you. “It is 9°C outside and the time is 16h47.” The person next to you was already trying to get all of their stuff together while your things were scattered on the floor. You were the last to leave the plane as you had struggled finding all your belongings. Your shoe was somehow found two rows before yours which you only managed to find thanks to the love staff of the flight you had mostly slept through. 

“Thank you so much for the nice flight.” You thanked them in Korean and they were pleasantly surprised you knew their mother tongue. That little thing was what you loved the most about speaking another language. People were usually shocked you spoke their words, their thoughts and were often pleased with your knowledge. 

“Have a nice stay in Seoul and don’t forget to enjoy the weather and cherry blossoms.” The smallest of the staff said while you got off the plane. If all Koreans were as nice as them then you’d have a great time working here. Yes, working. The reason for your sudden one way flight to Seoul was because you were offered a job here. You still had to take an interview and they still had about 5 applicants for the position.

blog.name: reactionbtsblog
blog.title: Kaah♡
blog.description:
~Tumblr de react & scenario~
Pedidos fechados (por enquanto)

body:
♡REACT♡ Você sendo uma rapper muito famosa e eles te vendo performar

Jin;

Ele ficaria muito encantado, e cantaria junto com vc toda a música e até arriscaria dançar uns passinhos.

“Que mulher linda”(gif)

Yoongi:

Ele ficaria babando a apresentação toda por vc, e prestaria toda a atenção em seus movimentos, ele também teria um sonho quase que secreto de fazer um feat com vc.

“A melhor rapper, sem dúvidas”

Hoseok:

Ele teria um ataque de fanboy, iria cantar todo o rap e dancar junto com vc, e ia gritar muito.

“essa mulher é incrível”

Namjoon:

Ele ia sorrir o tempo todo, estava muito feliz por ver vc ali, linda e baixinha em sua frente, ele realmente te amava e a admirava muito.

“Essa musica, essa voz, essa mulher… obrigado S/N por existir.”

Jimin:

Ficaria concentrado em toda a sua apresentação, e quando vc olhasse na direção dele, ficaria corado na hora.

“futura senhora Park, eu amo vc”

Taehyung:

Ele com certeza ficaria se imaginado ali, cantando do seu lado e se iludindo com fantasias com vc (igual nós cm ele msm), ficaria te olhando igual um bobo, babando pela idolo dele

“Tão linda…”

JungKook:

Ficaria um pouco enciumado por ter tantos caras babando por vc, mas ia apreciar o sua apresentação e falaria toda hora o quanto vc é linda.

“Olha Hyungs, ela é tão linda!”

Postei esses reacts a um tempo no wattpad, vou começar a postar alguns de lá aqui :)
